net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.telephony

Class TelephonyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.telephony.TelephonyController

  • public class TelephonyController
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides programmatic access to common call control tasks.

    As an Instance

    An instance of this class provides programmatic access to the Android OS internal telephony controller. This class is based on several interesting StackOverflow posts and is still highly experimental. The member functions represent a large portion of the ITelephony interface as discovered in the Android open source repository. However, in this class, several of those methods are marked as deprecated. For each of these deprecated methods, there is a static alternative that does not require the reflexive workarounds of this class, and which will likely be more efficient. Though marked as deprecated, there is no plan to remove them from this library; the deprecation is merely an encouragement to choose alternatives.

    As a Static Utils Class

    Static methods of the class are a more intuitive shorthand for "normal" operations related to call control, and do not require the construction of an instance.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.5 (#16)
    See Also:
    StackOverflow Q.599443: How to hang up outgoing call in Android?, StackOverflow Q.2001146: Reflection to access advanced telephony features, Prasanta Paul, "Call Control in Android", 2010-09-03, Android Source: com.android.internal.telephony.ITelephony, StackOverflow Q.4816683: How to make a phone call programmatically

    • Method Detail

      • getManager

        public static android.telephony.TelephonyManager getManager(android.content.Context ctx)
        Fetches an instance of the device's telephony manager.

        Returns:
        the device's telephony manager service

      • getCallState

        public static int getCallState(android.content.Context ctx)
                        throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Indicates the current call state. Equivalent to calling TelephonyManager.getCallState() on an existing instance of the manager. This method requires the android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission, and will throw a SecurityException if the permission is not granted at runtime.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to check call state
        Returns:
        one of the call state indicators provided by TelephonyManager: CALL_STATE_RINGING, CALL_STATE_OFFHOOK, or CALL_STATE_IDLE
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission is not granted to the app at runtime

      • isIdle

        public static boolean isIdle(android.content.Context ctx)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Indicates whether the phone is in "idle" state — that is, no outbound or inbound calls are in progress.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to check call state
        Returns:
        true if the call state is "idle"
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission is not granted to the app at runtime

      • getDataState

        public static int getDataState(android.content.Context ctx)
        Indicates the current call state. Equivalent to calling TelephonyManager.getDataState() on an existing instance of the manager.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to check data state
        Returns:
        one of the data state indicators provided by TelephonyManager: TelephonyManager.DATA_DISCONNECTED, TelephonyManager.DATA_CONNECTING, TelephonyManager.DATA_CONNECTED, or TelephonyManager.DATA_SUSPENDED

      • placeCall

        public static void placeCall(android.content.Context ctx,
                             java.lang.String sNumber)
                      throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Places an outbound call to the specified telephone number. This method requires the android.permission.CALL_PHONE permission, and will throw a SecurityException if the permission is not granted at runtime.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context in which to initiate the call
        sNumber - a telephone number
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the android.permission.CALL_PHONE permission is not granted to the app at runtime
        See Also:
        PermissionCheckpoint.checkPermission(android.content.Context, java.lang.String)

      • invoke

        protected java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.String sMethod,
                                  java.lang.Class<?>[] aclsTypes,
                                  java.lang.Object[] aoParams)
                           throws ControllerInvocationException
        Standard method of reflectively invoking a method of the telephony manager.
        Parameters:
        sMethod - the name of the underlying method being invoked
        aclsTypes - an array of parameter types, corresponding to the paramters given in aoParams (since zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.6 (#17))
        aoParams - any parameters that would be passed to the underlying method, corresponding to the types given in aclsTypes (since zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.6 (#17))
        Returns:
        the return value of the underlying method
        Throws:
        ControllerInvocationException - if the invocation fails
